skillTree.name: Tuskgor Chariot
skillTree.description: Pugnacious and stubborn, the war beasts that pull these ramshackle chariots are grotesque combinations of great boar and mighty ram.

skillTree.name: Razorgor Chariot
skillTree.description: Those strong enough to tame the powerful, unruly Razorgors can harness them for chariots.

skillTree.name: Fuelled by Blood
skillTree.description: Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.

skillTree.name: Voice of the Dark Gods
skillTree.description: This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.

skillTree.name: Distorted Reality
skillTree.description: A palpable miasma of fell sorcery surrounds the Bray-Shaman, distorting and maiming reality.

skillTree.name: Darkling Spirit
skillTree.description: Shamans do not generally engage in physical combat themselves, instead sending out their spirit to possess a suitably monstrous surrogate.

skillTree.name: Speaker of Darkling Counsel
skillTree.description: Bray-Shamans speak the will of the Dark Gods, and those that defy them pay the highest price of all.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for all spells

Winds of Magic cost: +2 for all enemy spells
	(local enemy armies)

skillTree.name: Uncanny Senses
skillTree.description: He knows. Nobody knows how, but he does. He has always just known.

skillTree.name: Shadow Hide
skillTree.description: Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in battle, this Lord will be wounded instead

skillTree.name: Dreads & Charms
skillTree.description: Impenetrably matted fur and grim trinkets make the Bray-Shamans more than just vile to behold, but incredibly hard to injure.

skillTree.name: Hardened Pelts
skillTree.description: By the Bray-Shaman’s incantations, those lesser in body or mind have their hair and fur clogged into impervious hides.

effects.description:
Armour: +15 for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.name: Dual Wielder
skillTree.description: In the right hands the braystaff is not just a symbol of position or conduit of magic, but also a brutal weapon.

skillTree.name: Bellows of the Discordant
skillTree.description: In frenzied ritual celebration the Bray-Shaman invokes the Dark Gods’ power to infuse the herds with bestial strength.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +15% for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

skillTree.name: Devolve
skillTree.description: The Bray-Shaman magnifies the savage and animalistic parts of the foe's psyche until they are no more than growling beasts.

ui_effects.description: ➕ 25% chance to deal 10 direct damage to 20 entities per second
➕ 25% chance to deal 10 direct damage to 20 entities per second
➕ 25% chance to deal 10 direct damage to 20 entities per second
➕ 25% chance to deal 10 direct damage to 20 entities per second

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Devolve Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Bestial Surge
skillTree.description: The Bray-Shaman inflames the uncontrollable urge to rend the foe limb from limb, causing the roaring, bellowing mass to surge forward.

skillTree.name: Bray-Scream
skillTree.description: This spell unleashes a howling roar of such intensity that it mashes brains and bursts eyeballs.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Bray-Scream Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Viletide
skillTree.description: A vile wave indeed, the creeping things that nest in the decaying undergrowth swarm all over the foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Viletide Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Traitor-Kin
skillTree.description: A red-hot spear of wrath is driven into enemy mounts' wild hearts, causing them to turn upon their riders.

ui_effects.description: ➕ 50% chance to deal 50 direct damage to 5 entities per second
➕ 50% chance to deal 50 direct damage to 5 entities per second
➕ 50% chance to deal 50 direct damage to 5 entities per second
➕ 50% chance to deal 50 direct damage to 5 entities per second

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Traitor-Kin Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Mantle of Ghorok
skillTree.description: Ghorok was a legendary Minotaur, ferocious as a storm. His spirit-mantle is terrible and dangerous to the bearer.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Mantle of Ghorok Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Mantle of Ghorok"
Miscast base chance: -10% for "Mantle of Ghorok Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Savage Dominion
skillTree.description: The Bray-Shaman sends his mind into the wilds, possessing the largest creature he can find and storming back with a vengeance.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -5 for "Savage Dominion"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for all spells

ui_effects.description: ➕ Improves power recharge rate by 1 every 7 seconds

skillTree.name: Presence of Morrslieb
skillTree.description: The great green orb hangs ominously in the sky above, its followers driven to acts of madness and depravity.

skillTree.name: Fury of the Herd
skillTree.description: A summons to war in which all are drawn into the cacophonous charge; glory or sanguine death is the prize.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, God Gors and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +8 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, God Gors and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Leader of the Raucous Host
skillTree.description: At the head of the warherd, he whips his followers into a frothing furore, then unleashes them upon the enemy.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +5 for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +6% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +5% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +20 for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Beastlord’s Spite
skillTree.description: The Beastlord truly has no mercy – those who flee will soon find all paths lead to a brutal end by arrow or axe.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Reload Speed: +3% for Ungor Raiders and Centigors (Throwing Axes) units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +15% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +5% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Reload Speed: +6% for Ungor Raiders and Centigors (Throwing Axes) units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +15% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Reload Speed: +12% for Ungor Raiders and Centigors (Throwing Axes) units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Beastlord's Lash
skillTree.description: No beast can truly be controlled, but these desperate contrivances bring the smallest semblance of order.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +5 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +20 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Hoofed Heavyweights
skillTree.description: These colossal, brutish warriors are the core of any true brayherd.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Freakish Mutations
skillTree.description: Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +3% for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +5% for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Call of Violence
skillTree.description: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."

skillTree.name: Unrelenting Savagery
skillTree.description: The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 10% for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, God Gors and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, God Gors and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Creatures of the Herd
skillTree.description: The Beastmen’s elite menagerie – the brayherds – slaughter all those caught in their savage, animalistic sights.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 15% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Razorgor Herd, Razorgor Chariot, Tuskgor Chariot, Chaos Warhounds, and Harpies units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +15% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Razorgor Herd, Razorgor Chariot, Tuskgor Chariot, Chaos Warhounds, and Harpies units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +15 for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Razorgor Herd, Razorgor Chariot, Tuskgor Chariot, Chaos Warhounds, and Harpies units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Bestial Butchers
skillTree.description: Only a select few from a herd gain their Beastlord's acknowledgement – a prize earned through the carnage and chaos they spread in battle.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 10% for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Mage Hunter
skillTree.description: The stench of magic is palpable. No mage can stand in the midst of battle against the baying warherds.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes) and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Magic resistance: 15% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Apocalyptic Vision
skillTree.description: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.

skillTree.name: Gargantuan Hooves
skillTree.description: The ground shakes. The earth moves. The spirit trembles. The Beastman comes.

skillTree.name: Feasting Upon Man
skillTree.description: For those who face the warherd, a fate worse than death awaits their salivating jaws and unremitting bloodlust.

skillTree.name: Blessed by Evil
skillTree.description: Unknowingly, the Beastmen serve their dark and Ruinous Gods, who in turn bless their every action.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%

skillTree.name: Dark Apothecary
skillTree.description: The Dark Apothecaries mix their fell unguents, ensuring those that can continue to serve.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ruination
skillTree.description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +20% when laying siege
	(local region)

skillTree.name: Unholy Resilience
skillTree.description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for Lords
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Corruption
skillTree.description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

effects.description:
Attrition: +3% casualties suffered from Chaos territory attrition
	(local enemy armies)

Attrition: +6% casualties suffered from Chaos territory attrition
	(local enemy armies)

Attrition: +10% casualties suffered from Chaos territory attrition
	(local enemy armies)

skillTree.name: Gathering of Beasts
skillTree.description: When the warherd gathers, there is much feasting, debauchery, and revelling in mania and depravity.

skillTree.name: Foul Premonitions
skillTree.description: Brought into this world by the cataclysm of Chaos, Beastmen are the very image of a dread future.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +25%

skillTree.name: Children of Chaos
skillTree.description: They bray beneath the weird, green moon, and do their perverse, grim butchery in the name of the heretical Gods.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.name: Share the Power
skillTree.description: Everyone wants power, so sacrifices must be made.

skillTree.name: Maintenance
skillTree.description: FACTIONWIDE: all source of income: -1%. Effect is additive. Negated on level 30 of character.

backgroundSkills.name: Booze Cravings
backgroundSkills.description: Some beings just don't know when to put the bottle down.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +5% for Centigor units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Khorne's Fury
backgroundSkills.description: More than mere bloodlust, this one is filled with the primal, Ruinous rage of the Lord of Battle.

backgroundSkills.name: Nurgle's Foul Stink
backgroundSkills.description: This one has something of the compost heap about them…

backgroundSkills.name: Torment Utterances
backgroundSkills.description: The Dark Tongue is an apt medium through which to torment, mock and enrage the foe.

backgroundSkills.name: Unsated Bloodthirst
backgroundSkills.description: Sometimes, letting so much blood that the soil itself is stained just isn't enough. And it will never be.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Minotaur units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Cunning
backgroundSkills.description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

backgroundSkills.name: Determined
backgroundSkills.description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

backgroundSkills.name: Confident
backgroundSkills.description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

backgroundSkills.name: Disciplined
backgroundSkills.description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.

backgroundSkills.name: Perceptive
backgroundSkills.description: Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

backgroundSkills.name: Aggressive
backgroundSkills.description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.

backgroundSkills.name: Tough
backgroundSkills.description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.

backgroundSkills.name: Strong
backgroundSkills.description: Well built, robust. Powerful.

backgroundSkills.name: Weapon Master
backgroundSkills.description: If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.

backgroundSkills.name: Strategist
backgroundSkills.description: This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

backgroundSkills.name: Tactician
backgroundSkills.description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Viletide [HIDDEN]
backgroundSkills.description: This spell calls to the creeping things of the undergrowth, sending a swarm of spiders, centipedes and slug-beetles onto the foe.

ui_effects.description: ➕ 25% chance to deal 10 direct damage to 20 entities per second

backgroundSkills.name: Rotten
backgroundSkills.description: Blessed by the Dark Gods to never feel pain.

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

backgroundSkills.name: Cloven Herald
backgroundSkills.description: His scent is strong even amongst the herd.

backgroundSkills.name: Tyrant
backgroundSkills.description: Ungors obey!

effects.description:
Melee and missile weapon damage: +10% for Ungor units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Unbroken
backgroundSkills.description: Herds crumble but he stands.

backgroundSkills.name: Raised with Hounds
backgroundSkills.description: Wild as a warhound, he never sleeps.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +4 for Chaos Warhounds and Harpies units.
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Ambusher
backgroundSkills.description: Always watching and stalking his pray!

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(all units in army)
